metadata.synopsis: Zevlor is tense - he's awaiting a long-expected attack on the grove, and the player is likely here to confirm it or perhaps even strike the first blow against him. Zevlor's usual tone is all stiff upper-lip, but at certain points we'll see the cracks start to form.
metadata.how_to_trigger: From crashsite:in reCon: oe readyattackondenteleport S_DEN_TieflingLeaderorin reCon: oe readyattackondenwalk to front on den gateskip through entrancemeeting dialogueteleport S_DEN_TieflingLeader

5.speaker: Zevlor
5.text: I think... I think that's the last of them.
5.context: NodeContext: Elated but trembling, in shock - he'd hoped they would survive but never fully believed it.

17.speaker: Zevlor
17.text: Gods, it's done. It's over. Just... just give me a moment.
17.context: NodeContext: His first true sign of vulnerability - he's presented a facade of calm and control to the people he leads, and he's letting it go for just a moment.

10.speaker: Zevlor
10.text: Gods above, you're alive. A little light, just as the day seems darkest.
10.context: NodeContext: He's relieved to see you, but warning of the impending attack - player might just have jumped out of the frying pan and into the fire.

45.speaker: Zevlor
45.text: I'd given you up for dead at the goblin camp - I'm damn glad to be wrong.

28.speaker: Zevlor
28.text: Gods! You have a habit of turning up where you're least expected - but no less welcome for that.

64.speaker: Zevlor
64.text: But what happened? We've seen them massing in the woods.

20.speaker: Zevlor
20.text: We've spotted goblins in the woods - what happened at their camp?

100.speaker: Player
100.text: They are my horde. Together, we shall feast upon you.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I met the drow leading them - and led her here.

82.speaker: Zevlor
82.text: You led the drow here? By the Nine Hells, why?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I want to see droves, piles, heaps of dead. I want to climb a corpsed mountain.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: She tricked the location out of me. It was a mistake - but I mean to make up for it.

39.speaker: Zevlor
39.text: A mistake? It's a damned - gods damn it, we're not ready for this.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Trust me - she thinks we're on the same side.

53.speaker: Zevlor
53.text: Our trap? I can't help but feel that we're the ones backed into a corner.

58.speaker: Zevlor
58.text: But... if you say you're a match for this drow, I suppose that's the best chance we have.

85.speaker: Zevlor
85.text: The horn. If you seek to draw her in, that damned thing's loud as thunder. It'll give our people a chance to take shelter, too.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Relax - this is a trap, and now she's walking right into it.

8.speaker: Zevlor
8.text: So... what? We're to be bait for this drow? Gods above, I...

101.speaker: Zevlor
101.text: If this is what it has come to, then... so be it. You'll need to draw her attention.

24.speaker: Zevlor
24.text: The horn - damn thing's loud as thunder. It'll give our people a chance to take shelter, too.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Simple. This grove belongs to the Absolute now.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: The goblins are coming - and they're led by a drow.

81.speaker: Zevlor
81.text: Truly? Hells, I didn't expect her to... We were almost ready to leave.
81.context: NodeContext: Quietly - he's usually polite and pragmatic, but you've just confirmed that they're facing overwhelming odds. Rare moment of vulnerabilty before the mask is restored in the next node.

4.speaker: Zevlor
4.text: Well. There's nothing for it, now - a fight it will have to be.
4.context: NodeContext: Fatalistic - he usually respects the gods but praying has availed him nothing. He appreciates your will to act.

22.speaker: Zevlor
22.text: We threw them back once. If you're with us... perhaps we can do it again.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: No point waiting around then. What do you need?

47.speaker: Zevlor
47.text: We need to thin the goblin numbers quickly if we're to have any chance of survival.
47.context: NodeContext: Grim - the next few lines are him explaining a course of action he'd rather not take, but emphasising that there's no choice.

16.speaker: Zevlor
16.text: Every ounce of oil that we could spare has been buried out in front of the gate.

35.speaker: Zevlor
35.text: We'll blow the horn to draw them in, and pray our fire-arrows strike true.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: A challenge for all to witness. She'll have a hard time resisting.

96.speaker: Zevlor
96.text: Good. She's expecting to find us weak and desperate - and she's not wrong.

12.speaker: Zevlor
12.text: But she'll find you waiting, too.

37.speaker: Zevlor
37.text: See to your preparations and then sound the horn. Let's have this done.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: We'll get through this, I swear to you.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: She'll take the bait - and with the defences ready, we'll win the day.

87.speaker: Zevlor
87.text: Your courage is catching, it seems. Or perhaps I've finally lost my reason.

33.speaker: Zevlor
33.text: Make what preparations you deem necessary, and then sound the horn. Let's have this done.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: I can't tell if that's a really good plan or an awful one.

75.speaker: Zevlor
75.text: Believe me, I've prayed to find one - but the gods have seen fit to stay out of this.
75.context: NodeContext: Firm. He's reached a decision, even if it is a dangeorus one.

21.speaker: Zevlor
21.text: You haven't - and so we place our faith in you instead.
21.context: NodeContext: He's settling into state of fatalistic resolve - he's tried everything else to keep these people safe, but there's no reasoning with goblins.

62.speaker: Zevlor
62.text: Hah. What I have is no choice - we need to thin their numbers quickly if we're to survive.
62.context: NodeContext: Grim - the next few lines are him explaining a course of action he'd rather not take, but emphasising that there's no choice.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: You've fortified the place well - we're ready for them.

55.speaker: Zevlor
55.text: We have the barricades - just not the warriors to man them. If we're to survive, we'll need to thin the goblin numbers quickly.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I am just here for the show. I want to see you all die.

88.speaker: Wyll
88.text: No - you can't! I trusted you!
88.context: NodeContext: Upset, the player has given up the entire tiefling grove for slaughter.

70.speaker: Zevlor
70.context: NodeContext: It takes him a moment to realise what he's being told - that the player has betrayed them and sided with the goblins.

74.speaker: Zevlor
74.text: You've turned on us? Hells, why?

91.speaker: Player
91.text: It's who I am. Sin incarnate.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I... don't know. I'm sorry. I wanted to save you, but it seems I'm too weak.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I follow a god of death. That requires the occasional offering.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I didn't turn on anyone. I look out for myself.

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: Traitor. The Blade now comes for you.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Don't look for reasons - it's nothing personal.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Why? For the glory of the Absolute, of course!

48.speaker: Player
48.text: With you? You misunderstand - I'm with them.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Take heart. My god is watching over us.

25.speaker: Zevlor
25.text: I suspect we'll need it before the day is done. The fact is, we cannot withstand a siege.

54.speaker: Zevlor
54.text: If it's to be battle, sooner is better than later. We need to ready ourselves and goad this drow into attacking.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Take heart. My god is watching over us.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Their drow leader found the grove. I couldn't stop it - I'm sorry.

41.speaker: Zevlor
41.text: Mrag. It... it doesn't matter now, I suppose. You have nothing to apologise for.

65.speaker: Zevlor
65.text: If it must be bloodshed after all, I'm glad to have you with us.

31.speaker: Zevlor
31.text: We're ready to head to your camp - are you?

50.speaker: Zevlor
50.text: Well, are you ready? Are we?
50.context: NodeContext: A hint of impatience, but acknowledging that you're the one calling the shots.

57.speaker: Zevlor
57.text: From what little I've learned of goblins, they won't resist an invitation like that.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Take me through the plan again.

49.speaker: Zevlor
49.text: I wish it were as complicated as all that.
49.context: NodeContext: Nervous and afraid, but still a little humour - their plan is a foolish one.

1.speaker: Zevlor
1.text: This drow is no fool - she knows the smart thing is to be patient, starve us out.

60.speaker: Zevlor
60.text: I mean to prick at her pride - give her no choice but to be stupid. Sound the horn - let's have this done.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Not yet - I need more time.

68.speaker: Zevlor
68.text: Do what you must, but quickly. Once you sound the horn, they'll come running.

15.speaker: Zevlor
15.text: I'd sooner start this on our terms than theirs.

89.speaker: Zevlor
89.text: You can understand why we've had to be cautious at the gates.

40.speaker: Zevlor
40.text: When the Blade told me of what you'd done, I was loathe to believe it.

59.speaker: Zevlor
59.text: I'm glad to see his fears weren't as bad as he imagined.

43.speaker: Zevlor
43.text: I know we can make a stand here. We have to. Your help will be welcome.
